newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Budi to link-up with local, Japan firms.
newsitem.headline: Budi to link-up with local, Japan firms.

text.p: Indonesia's tapioca starch maker PT Budi Acid Jaya said on Wednesday it is negotiating to set up two joint ventures with local and Japanese firms to boost sales.

"We are currently negotiating to set up the joint ventures, one with a big local firm and the other one with a Japanese firm. We'll let you know soon," vice president director Sudarmo Tasmin told Reuters.
Budi Acid made strong gains as it rose 300 rupiah, or 10.34 percent, to close at 3,200 rupiah, with around 1.7 million shares changing hands on the Jakarta stock exchange on Wednesday.
Sudarmo declined to give further details.
